schools.name: Cycle Ingénieur en Management Industriel (EMINES)
schools.description: This high-level engineering program focuses on industrial management, equipping students with the skills to optimize industrial processes, enhance productivity, and lead in manufacturing and service industries. The curriculum integrates engineering principles with management strategies to prepare graduates for leadership roles in industrial settings.

schools.name: Cycle Ingénieur en Computer Sciences (English) (UM6P-CC)
schools.description: This program offers an English-taught curriculum in computer sciences engineering, covering areas such as software development, data structures, algorithms, and artificial intelligence. It prepares students to tackle complex computing challenges and innovate in the rapidly evolving tech industry.

schools.name: Cycle Ingénieur en Ingénierie Physique (IST&I)
schools.description: A specialized engineering program in physical sciences, focusing on the application of physics principles to solve engineering problems. Students gain expertise in areas such as materials science, nanotechnology, and applied optics, preparing them for careers in research and high-tech industries.

schools.name: Master Technologies Industrielles pour l’Usine du Futur (GTI)
schools.description: This master's program centers on industrial technologies for the factory of the future, emphasizing smart manufacturing, automation, and digital transformation. It prepares students to lead innovations in industrial settings, focusing on efficiency and advanced manufacturing techniques.

schools.name: Master Collective Intelligence (English) (SCI)
schools.description: This master's program focuses on collective intelligence strategies, exploring how groups, organizations, and societies can harness collective knowledge and decision-making. It integrates insights from psychology, sociology, and technology to enhance collaborative processes and innovation.

schools.name: Master International Management (English) (ABS)
schools.description: A global business management program that prepares students for leadership roles in international contexts. The curriculum covers global strategy, cross-cultural management, and international marketing, equipping graduates to navigate the complexities of global business environments.

schools.name: Master AgriBusiness Innovation (English) (ABS)
schools.description: This master's program focuses on agribusiness innovation, addressing the challenges of modern agriculture through technological advancements and innovative business models. It prepares students to drive transformation in the agricultural sector, enhancing productivity and sustainability.

schools.name: Master Global Affairs (FGSES)
schools.description: A master's program covering international relations and global politics, focusing on diplomacy, global governance, and international conflict resolution. Students develop a deep understanding of geopolitical trends and the complexities of the international system.

schools.name: Master Analyse Economique et Politiques Publiques (FGSES)
schools.description: An advanced economics and public policy program that combines economic theory with practical policy analysis. It prepares students to evaluate and design effective public policies addressing economic and social issues.

schools.name: Master Behavioral and Social Sciences for Public Policy (FGSES)
schools.description: This master's program explores the application of behavioral sciences in policymaking, examining how human behavior and decision-making processes influence public policy outcomes. Students gain insights into cognitive biases, social influences, and economic behaviors that shape policy decisions.
